DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: KHERANI, E. A.;Kherani, E. A.;E. Alam Kherani;E.A. Kherani;Kherani, A.;Kherani, E. Alam;Alam Kherani;kherani A.E.;KHERANI, A. E.;KHERANI, E.A.

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH:
Doutorado (Ph.D.) pelo Physical Research Laboratory da ndia em 2002, atualmente Pesquisador adjunto, no INPE (Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais), onde realiza estudos sobre a dinmica da Ionosfera/Atmosfera em diversos aspectos atravs do emprego de simulaes numricas, alm de orientar estudantes do programa de ps-graduao desta instituio.
Memorial: 1. Pesquisador Adjunto (desde Maro 2013, passei com primeiro lugar em concurso) : Diviso da Aeronomia, Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais (INPE), So Jos dos Campos, Brasil, 2. Auxilo ou Bolsistas adquire durante ultima 5 anos:Jovem Pesquisador (FAPESP, 2012-2014),Pesquisador visitante (IPGP-Paris, Maio 2011-Dezembro 2012), Ps-doutorado (FAPESP, 2007-2011, 3 anos). 3. Produo Cientfica durante ltimos 10 anos: publicou 25 artigos em jornais internacionais, 2 artigos em livros internacionais da editora Springer, alm de 23 resumos em conferncias (Nacionais e Internacionais). 4. Objetivos: (a) O estudo do comportamentos da atmosfera-Ionosfera com diferentes condioes meteorolgicas, (b) O estudo do comportamentos da atmosfera-Ionosfera antes/durantes os terremotos/tsunami. 5. Linha de Pesquisa: (a) o estudo da instabilidade da plasma na Ionosfera, (b) O mecanismo do acoplamento da sistema atmosfera-Ionosfera, (c) as observaes das irregularidades da Ionosfera com uso de Radar, Digissondas e imageadores All-Sky, (d) O mecanismo do acoplamento da sistema Litosfera-Atmosfera-Ionosfera e Tsunami-Atmosfera-Ionosfera. 6. Pesquisas so realizados: (a) O desenvolvimento de cdigo de simulao hidrodinmica na atmosfera, (b) O desenvolvimento de cdigo de simulao hidromagntica da instabilidade Colisional Interchange na Ionosfera, (sendo este o terceiro, de trs existentes na comunidade cientfica)), (c) o desenvolvimento de cdigo do acoplamento da sistema Tsunami-Atmosfera-Ionosfera
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: doctorate at Ph.d from PHYSICAL RESEARCH LABORATORY (2001). Has experience in Geosciences, focusing on Geophysics, acting on the following subjects: plasma instabilities, ionospehric irregularities, ionospere, simulao computacional das irregularidades ionosf and irregularidades do plasma ionosfrico.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Traveling ionospheric disturbances: Simulation and Observation, the importance of latitudinal coupling of gravity wave-Perkins-Es layer instabilities and forcing from pre-seismic events
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
In the mid-latitude ionosphere, the night-time Meso-scale Traveling Ionospheric Disturbances (MSTIDs) are the common phenomenon occurring in the F region. While numerous observations are devoted to study these phenomenon the theoret- ical work has legged far behind experiments. Two proposed mechanism are the following: (1) the excitation of MSTIDs by the combined action of gravity wave (AGWs) of auroral origin and Perkins instability (PI), (2) the excitation of the MSTIDs by the combined action of Perkins instability and Es-layer instability (EsI). Recently, Kelley (2011) recommends an unified approach involving AGW, PI and EsI that may account for most of the observed characteristics of MSTIDs. In the current research proposal, I propose the development of AGW-PI-EsI model under which following new simulation models will be developed: (1) the AGWs propaga- tion model from the high-latitude to mid/low-latitude atmosphere; (2) the Perkins instability model in the mid/low-latitude ionosphere; (3) the Es-layer instability model. The proposed unified model does not exist in the ionospheric community at present and its development in the present research proposal may ensure to explain numerous observed phenomenon for the first time. While the proposal is mainly theoretical in nature, an observation campaign of MSTIDs using dense GPS net- work together with all-sky imager and digisonde in the Brazilian southern region is also proposed.
After the Japan tsunami, the airglow measurements reported by Makela et al (2011) have shown for the first time that the ionospheric disturbances associ- ated with the pre-tsunami can be identified even in the presence of much stronger MSTIDs. The causative mechanism for these pre-seismic-traveling-ionosphereic dis- turbances (PSTIDs) is not known but observations by Lognonn ́ et al (2011) show e the strong evidence of slow-slip process beneath the Earth during their observation. At present, what is lacking
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Traveling ionospheric disturbances: Simulation and Observation, the importance of latitudinal coupling of gravity wave-Perkins-Es layer instabilities and forcing from pre-seismic events

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Institute de Physique du Globo de Paris

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: The Tohoku-Oki earthquake from Earth to Oceans and Space: a critical case-study to improve earthquake and tsunami (TO_EOS)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: We propose to analyze the unprecedented data, both terrestrial, oceanic and spatial, related to the Mw9.0, 2011 Tohoku-oki, Japan, earthquake to improve our ability to anticipate on future large earthquakes and tsunami. The project includes three parts each exploring a different approach of the problem: - imaging of the whole earthquake sequence from years before the earthquake to the post- seismic deformation to infer the parameters controlling the evolution of the seismic cycle, - perform a detailed analysis and modeling of the ionospheric signals related to the earthquake and tsunami, and investigate the feasibility to use this approach for early-warning purpose, - perform a critical analysis and modeling of the possible slow-slip events prior the Tohoku-oki earthquake suggested in the airglow and deep sea-bottom pressure data (Makela et al., in pres). Hence, the capacity of this project to make significant improvements on earthquake and tsunami anticipation not only relies on an in-depth analysis of the unique data of the Tohoku- oki earthquake and tsunami, but it also extends the spectrum of the analysis via original and multidisciplinary tasks combining land, sea and space data.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The Tohoku-Oki earthquake from Earth to Oceans and Space: a critical case-study to improve earthquake and tsunami
